rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C114118

definition: A terminology codelist relevant to protocol-specified, point-in-time events during a study.
name: Protocol Milestone

terms.definition: An indication that the subject has declined to continue into a subsequent trial Element.
terms.preferredTerm: Declined to Continue Into Next Trial Element
terms.submissionValue: DECLINED TO CONTINUE INTO NEXT TRIAL ELEMENT

terms.definition: An indication that the subject has declined to continue into the survival follow-up phase of the trial.
terms.preferredTerm: Declined To Continue Into Survival Follow-Up
terms.submissionValue: DECLINED TO CONTINUE INTO SURVIVAL FOLLOW-UP

terms.definition: The subject has fulfilled the criteria needed to enter or continue in the study.
The subject has met eligibility criteria and is enrolled in the study. The subject may or may not subsequently be randomized.

Assent given by a minor or adult who is unable to give informed consent on their own behalf, to participate in a clinical trial. Assent must be accompanied by consent from a parent or legal guardian for full participation in the study.

Consent given by a subject, or in the case of an individual that can only give assent, by a parent or legal guardian, for the participation in a clinical study only after having achieved an understanding of both the relevant medical facts and the relevant risks involved.
An indication that the subject has opted to continue into a subsequent trial Element.
terms.preferredTerm: Opted to Continue Into Next Trial Element
terms.submissionValue: OPTED TO CONTINUE INTO NEXT TRIAL ELEMENT

terms.definition: An indication that the subject has opted to continue into the survival follow-up phase of the trial.
terms.preferredTerm: Opted To Continue Into Survival Follow-Up
terms.submissionValue: OPTED TO CONTINUE INTO SURVIVAL FOLLOW-UP

terms.definition: Participants are assigned to arms of a clinical trial by chance.
Participants are re-assigned by chance to arms of a clinical trial.
